DataElement.preferredName: DART Past Month Daily Activity Rating Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's self-rating over the past month of their general daily activity, using an 5 point scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Distress Assessment and Response Tool Past 30 days Daily Activity Rating Scale Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A short, self-assessment to measure an individual's physical symptoms, emotional burden and practical concerns that could interfere with their ability to engage in cancer treatment._A period of time consisting of the 30 days before the present._A scale from 0 to 4 for an individual to rate their perception of their daily activities._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A short, self-assessment to measure an individual's physical symptoms, emotional burden and practical concerns that could interfere with their ability to engage in cancer treatment.

Concepts.definition: A short, self-assessment to measure an individual's physical symptoms, emotional burden and practical concerns that could interfere with their ability to engage in cancer treatment.

Property.preferredName: Past 30 Days Daily Activity Rating Scale Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A period of time consisting of the 30 days before the present.:A scale from 0 to 4 for an individual to rate their perception of their daily activities. :A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A period of time consisting of the 30 days before the present.
A scale from 0 to 4 for an individual to rate their perception of their daily activities.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: DART:Distress Assessment and Response Tool, Form D-5668. University Health Network DART Team, Toronto, Canada, 3/2013.
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Princess Margaret MBO request 11.8.17 mc

ValueDomain.preferredName: DART Daily Activity Rating 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A short, self-assessment to measure an individual's physical symptoms, emotional burden and practical concerns that could interfere with their ability to engage in cancer treatment._A scale from 0 to 4 for an individual to rate their perception of their daily activities._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pretty much bedridden, rarely out of bed

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pretty much bedridden, rarely out of bed
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is pretty much bedridden, rarely out of bed.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is pretty much bedridden, rarely out of bed.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Able to do little activity and spend most of the day in bed or chair

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Able to do little activity and spend most of the day in bed or chair
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do little activity and spends most of the day in bed or chair.

Concepts.longName: Little Activity; in Bed or Chair Most of Day
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do little activity and spends most of the day in bed or chair.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Not feeling up to most things, but in bed or chair less than half the day

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Not feeling up to most things, but in bed or chair less than half the day
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is not feeling up to most things, but in bed or chair less than half the day.

Concepts.longName: Not Feeling Well; in Bed or Chair Less than Half Day
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is not feeling up to most things, but in bed or chair less than half the day.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Not my normal self, but able to be up and about with fairly normal activities

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Not my normal self, but able to be up and about with fairly normal activities
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is not their normal self, but able to be up and about with fairly normal activity.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is not their normal self, but able to be up and about with fairly normal activity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual's activity is normal with no limitations.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual's activity is normal with no limitations.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: A short, self-assessment to measure an individual's physical symptoms, emotional burden and practical concerns that could interfere with their ability to engage in cancer treatment.
A scale from 0 to 4 for an individual to rate their perception of their daily activities.
